en: Be ye therefore imitators of God, as beloved children;
hmr: Chuongchun, a nau dittakhai angin Pathien umdân latuhai ni ro.

en: and walk in love, even as Christ also loved you, and gave himself up for us, an offering and a sacrifice to God for an odor of a sweet smell.
hmr: Chun, Kristain a hmangai cheu a, riminhnik dinga Pathien kuoma thil inhlâna ding le, inthâwinaa ei aia ân pêk ang bawk khan, hmangainaah um ro.

en: But fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not even be named among you, as becometh saints;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mi inthienghai thawa mawi âwm tak hrimin, inditna le inthiengnawna po po, duamna leh nangni laiah a sâma sâm khawmin um naw raw se;

en: nor filthiness, nor foolish talking, or jesting, which are not befitting: but rather giving of thanks.
hmr: zâmaw dâm, thu teplo dâm, fiemthu dâm khawm, chuong chu a mawi naw a nih; chuong ti nêk chun lawmthu hril lem ro.

en: For this ye know of a surety, that no fornicator, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, hath any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God.
hmr: Indithmang le mi inthiengnaw le mi duâm hrim hrim chu, (mi duâm chu milim betu a nih), Krista le Pathien rama chun chan hrim an nei nawh ti in hriet hle sih a.

en: Let no man deceive you with empty words: for because of these things cometh the wrath of God upon the sons of disobedience.
hmr: Tûkhawmin thu teplo mei meiin hlêm naw raw se cheu, chuong thil lei chun Pathien lunginsenna chu ringnaw nauhai chungah a tlung hlak sih a.

en: Be not ye therefore partakers with them;
hmr: Chuleiin, anni inṭawmpui naw ro.

en: for ye were once darkness, but are now light in the Lord: walk as children of light
hmr: Inhma khan inthim in na, tu ruok hin chu Lalpaa chun var in hung ni ta hi, var nauhai angin um ro,

en: (for the fruit of the light is in all goodness and righteousness and truth),
hmr: (var ra chu ṭhatna le felna le thutak po poah ânlang sih a).

en: proving what is well-pleasing unto the Lord;
hmr: Lalpa lâwmzâwng ieng am a na ti infie pei bawk unla.

en: and have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather even reprove them;
hmr: Chun, inthim thilthaw ra nei ngailohaia chun ṭhangna hrim nei naw ro, ṭhang nêk hmanin a thiemnawzie inhriettir lem ro;

en: for the things which are done by them in secret it is a shame even to speak of.
hmr: inrûka an thil thaw hlakhai chu a hril khawm inzak a um sih a.

en: But all things when they are reproved are made manifest by the light: for everything that is made manifest is light.
hmr: Amiruokchu, thil tinrêng a thiemnawzie inhriettira um hi var isuklang a ni hlak,

en: Wherefore he saith, Awake, thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall shine upon thee.
hmr: suklanga um taphawt chu var a ni sih a. Chuleiin, “Nang a in! meng la, Mithi laia inthawkin tho rawh. Chuongchun, Krista chun, Hung ên var a ti che,” a ti kha.

en: Look therefore carefully how ye walk, not as unwise, but as wise;
hmr: Chuongchun, mi varnawhai anga um loin, mi varhai anga um lemin, in um dânah fîmkhur ro.

en: redeeming the time, because the days are evil.
hmr: Nihai hi a ṭhat naw leiin remchângnahai inchaw pei ro.

en: Wherefore be ye not foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.
hmr: Chuleichun, invêt nuom naw unla, Lalpa ditzâwng ieng am a na ti lo hre lem ro.

en: And be not drunken with wine, wherein is riot, but be filled with the Spirit;
hmr: Chun, uoin inruiin um naw ro, chutaka chun insûm nawna a um sih a; Thlaraua sipin um lem ro.

en: speaking one to another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody with your heart to the Lord;
hmr: Inpâkna hlahai, Pathien hlahai, thlarau tieng hlahaia inbe tuoin, Lalpa chu in lungrilah hla sakpêkin, ṭingṭang kei pêk ro.

en: giving thanks always for all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to God, even the Father;
hmr: Ei Lalpa Isu Krista hmingin, Pathien, Pa ngei kuoma chun, iengkim chungah lâwmthu hril ro.

en: subjecting yourselves one to another in the fear of Christ.
hmr: Krista ṭi dêkin intuklût tuo seng ro.

en: Wives, be in subjection unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.
hmr: Nuhmeihai, Lalpa kuoma in intuklût ang hin mani pasalhai kuomah intuklût seng ro.

en: For the husband is the head of the wife, as Christ also is the head of the church, being himself the saviour of the body.
hmr: Krista chu ama ngei taksa sandamtu nia, kohran lu a ni ang bawk hin, pasal chu a nuhmei lu a ni sih a.

en: But as the church is subject to Christ, so let the wives also be to their husbands in everything.
hmr: Chuongchun, kohran chu Krista kuoma ân tuklût ang bawkin, nu- hmeihai chu iengkimah an pasalhai kuomah intuklût raw hai se.

en: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself up for it;
hmr: Pasalhai, in nuhmeihai hma- ngai ro, Kristain kohran a hmangai a, a aia ama ân pêk ang khan,

en: that he might sanctify it, having cleansed it by the washing of water with the word,
hmr: kohran chu tuia sâwpa, thu chun sukfaia ân thieng theina dingin;

en: that he might present the church to himself a glorious church, not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.
hmr: fainawna kai lo le, zûr lo le, chuong ang thil hrim put loa, inthieng le hmêlhem nawa um lemin, ama kuoma vêk kohran ropui taka a pêk theina dingin.

en: Even so ought husbands also to love their own wives as their own bodies. He that loveth his own wife loveth himself:
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin pasalhai khawmin mani taksa angin mani nuhmeihai chu an hmangai ding a nih. Mani nuhmei hmangaitu chu mani inhmangai a nih.

en: for no man ever hated his own flesh; but nourisheth and cherisheth it, even as Christ also the church;
hmr: Tukhawmin, mani taksa a theida ngai si nawh a, a châwmin a duot lem hlak a nih.

en: because we are members of his body.
hmr: Kristain kohran a châwma a duot ang hin; a taksa pênghai ei ni sih a.

en: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife; and the two shall become one flesh.
hmr: “Chuleiin, pasalin a nu le pa mâksanin a nuhmei chel a ta, chun, an pahni chun tisa pumkhat hung ni tâng an tih.”

en: This mystery is great: but I speak in regard of Christ and of the church.
hmr: Chu thurûk chu a ropui a nih; nisienlakhawm, kei chun Krista le kohran thu ka hrilna a nih.

en: Nevertheless do ye also severally love each one his own wife even as himself; and let the wife see that she fear her husband.
hmr: Iengkhawm ni sien la, nangni laia mi tûkhawmin mani ân hmangai ang bawkin, mani nuhmei hmangai seng raw hai se; nuhmei khawm chu a pasal ṭi dêk dingin fimkhur raw se.
